alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Bullitt; Nelson; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nelson, central Washington and southeastern Bullitt Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Shepherdsville to 7 miles southeast of Bardstown. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Bullitt, central Washington, Nelson and southwestern Anderson Counties, including the following locations... Highgrove, Samuels Field Airport, Hobbs, Booker, Scuffletown, Deatsville, Cedar Grove, Bellwood, Belmont and Botland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
